str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Worthily, in a manner worthy of. Adverb from axios; appropriately.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A calling, invitation; in the NT, always of a divine call. From a shorter form of kaleo; an invitation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
